item.description:
How Dictators Use Dishonest Elections to Gain and Maintain Power
The Past, Present, and Future of Election Technology

Join us for a Live, Skype discussion with  KURT HYDE,  Co-Chair of The First National Symposium on Security and Reliability of Computers in the Electoral Process (1986). He is An Election History Expert, and a Systems Analysis Professor who writes for "The New American" magazine as an investigative Journalist. Professor Hyde is currently working on a new book outlining the complete history of the Electoral Process. 

Kurt Hyde will be appearing live, via Skype

HIGHLIGHTS:

    * The Ancient Roman elections
    * Tactics used by Stalin in the infamous stolen elections of 1946 and 1947 in Poland

    *Hitler's use of sham elections
    *More recent election fraud cases

    *Internet voting and hacking
    *Encryption.  A nice sounding word, but most computer crimes today are "Inside Jobs".

THIS EVENT IS FREE (Bring Someone!) ALL ARE WELCOME



To familiarize yourself with some of what is going to be discussed, watch the first 2mins of this MIT TechTV introduction and Kurt's presentation at 31:00

http://techtv.mit.edu/collections/vtp/videos/14804-eippf-2011-1-introduction-and-the-past

group.name: FREEDOM IS FUNDAMENTAL Book Club and Discussion Group

item.name: ELECTION INTEGRITY: PAST, PRESENT, & FUTURE Live Skype Interview w KURT HYDE
